body_html:
That helped a lot. Now I'm getting this one:

/home/thomas/code/pytorch/aten/src/ATen/Half-inl.h:115:65: error: ambiguous conversion for C-style cast from 'int' to 'at::Half'
inline AT_HOSTDEVICE Half operator+(Half a, int b) { return a + (Half)b; }
                                                                ^~~~~~~
/home/thomas/code/pytorch/aten/src/ATen/Half-inl.h:15:28: note: candidate constructor
inline AT_HOSTDEVICE Half::Half(float value) {
                           ^
/home/thomas/code/pytorch/aten/src/ATen/Half-inl.h:34:28: note: candidate constructor
inline AT_HOSTDEVICE Half::Half(const __half& value) {
                           ^
/home/thomas/code/pytorch/aten/src/ATen/Half.h:43:19: note: candidate is the implicit copy constructor
struct alignas(2) Half {
                  ^
/home/thomas/code/pytorch/aten/src/ATen/Half.h:43:19: note: candidate is the implicit copy constructor
/home/thomas/code/pytorch/aten/src/ATen/Half.h:43:19: note: candidate is the implicit move constructor
In file included from /home/thomas/code/pytorch/aten/src/THC/THCStorage.cu:1:
In file included from /home/thomas/code/pytorch/aten/src/THC/THCStorage.hpp:7:
In file included from /home/thomas/code/pytorch/aten/src/TH/THStorage.hpp:8:
In file included from /home/thomas/code/pytorch/aten/src/ATen/ScalarType.h:7:
In file included from /home/thomas/code/pytorch/aten/src/ATen/Half.h:111:

except there's like 1300 lines of it.

So it's having trouble overloading the int operators to use Half types instead.

/home/thomas/code/pytorch/aten/src/ATen/Half.h:74:12: error: use of overloaded operator '<' is ambiguous (with operand types 'long' and 'at::Half')
  return f < limit::lowest() || f > limit::max();
         ~ ^ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
/home/thomas/code/pytorch/aten/src/ATen/Half.h:90:7: note: in instantiation of function template specialization 'at::overflows<at::Half, long>' requested here
  if (overflows<To, From>(f)) {

body:
That helped a lot. Now I'm getting this one:
```
/home/thomas/code/pytorch/aten/src/ATen/Half-inl.h:115:65: error: ambiguous conversion for C-style cast from 'int' to 'at::Half'
inline AT_HOSTDEVICE Half operator+(Half a, int b) { return a + (Half)b; }
                                                                ^~~~~~~
/home/thomas/code/pytorch/aten/src/ATen/Half-inl.h:15:28: note: candidate constructor
inline AT_HOSTDEVICE Half::Half(float value) {
                           ^
/home/thomas/code/pytorch/aten/src/ATen/Half-inl.h:34:28: note: candidate constructor
inline AT_HOSTDEVICE Half::Half(const __half& value) {
                           ^
/home/thomas/code/pytorch/aten/src/ATen/Half.h:43:19: note: candidate is the implicit copy constructor
struct alignas(2) Half {
                  ^
/home/thomas/code/pytorch/aten/src/ATen/Half.h:43:19: note: candidate is the implicit copy constructor
/home/thomas/code/pytorch/aten/src/ATen/Half.h:43:19: note: candidate is the implicit move constructor
In file included from /home/thomas/code/pytorch/aten/src/THC/THCStorage.cu:1:
In file included from /home/thomas/code/pytorch/aten/src/THC/THCStorage.hpp:7:
In file included from /home/thomas/code/pytorch/aten/src/TH/THStorage.hpp:8:
In file included from /home/thomas/code/pytorch/aten/src/ATen/ScalarType.h:7:
In file included from /home/thomas/code/pytorch/aten/src/ATen/Half.h:111:
```
except there's like 1300 lines of it.

So it's having trouble overloading the int operators to use Half types instead. 

```
/home/thomas/code/pytorch/aten/src/ATen/Half.h:74:12: error: use of overloaded operator '<' is ambiguous (with operand types 'long' and 'at::Half')
  return f < limit::lowest() || f > limit::max();
         ~ ^ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
/home/thomas/code/pytorch/aten/src/ATen/Half.h:90:7: note: in instantiation of function template specialization 'at::overflows<at::Half, long>' requested here
  if (overflows<To, From>(f)) {
```
